caption.p: Reported neurological manifestations associated with MERS-CoV-infection

td.p: Clinical neurologic examination revealed dysmetria and decreased motor strenght on left side

tr.td: Findings consistent with acute disseminated encephalomyelitis (ADEM) or less probably encephalitis
Day 5 of hospitalization: unresponsiveness, hypotensive with left-sided facial paralysis
Hypertension, diabetes and peripheral vascular disease
Acute bilaterally non-occlusive stroke probably due to MERS-CoV-Vasculopathy
Day 24 of hospitalization: low Glasgow coma scale and fever
Hypertension, diabetes, chronic kidney disease, ischemic heart disease
Day 14 of hospitalization: severe headache, nausea and vomiting, decreased level of consciousness and Glasgow Coma Scale of 3/15
Weakness in both legs and inability to walk with numbness and tingling in stocking distribution
Day 13 of hospitalization: polyuric with urine osmolarity of 95 meq/L and serum osmolarity of 341 meq/L, unresponsiveness, GCS of 3/15, pupil diameter of 3 mm with sluggish reaction
